scenario_text.value: Oh, Takuma! Great timing!
What? Did you find something?
I saw a shadow that looked just like Aoi!
That, and some other weird...something.
What do you mean? You think it was an enemy?

Probably. But it’s hard to tell with the fog
being so thick.

Whatever it was, it didn’t seem very steady
on its feet.

Well, one way or another, it wouldn’t be safe
to ignore it.
Right, so Takuma...

...you think you can head over to where I saw
Aoi?

I’m gonna go back to the school and tell the
others about this.

Wait, really?! YOU’RE going back to the
school?
What? You got a problem with that?
(Honestly, I’m more surprised than anything.)

(Knowing Kaito, I’d expect him to say he’ll
bring her back and then just take off.)

(Is he actually holding back because I told
him not to overdo it?)
(How should I respond to Kaito?)
I’m just surprised.
Is this because of me?
You won’t regret this?
I’m just surprised.

I don’t have a problem with it... I’m just
surprised.

You were so concerned about Aoi, I thought
for sure you’d want to go after her yourself.

Oh, I do. Only...I don’t know if I can trust
myself to keep cool right now.

Actually, I’m already feeling pretty worked
up, so I thought I’d better leave it to you.
Is this because of me?

I’m stunned... Are you actually holding back
because of what I said earlier?
Nah, it’s not that.

Yeah, not a chance Takuma. You think this guy
could ever hold back for any reason?
Then why aren’t you going after Aoi?

It’s real simple. Because I think you’re more
likely to keep cool than I am right now.

So I figured I’d better leave dealing with
Aoi to you.
That’s all there is to it.
You won’t regret this?

Kaito, you said before that you felt
responsible for Aoi going missing.

Are you sure you’re okay with not going after
her yourself? You won’t regret this later?

To be honest, as soon as I saw that shadow,
I thought about going after her, but...

...I felt like if I was the one to catch up
to her, she might feel cornered.

I’m not the best talker, you know? I thought
I might say something wrong without thinking.

Besides, I figure you’re less likely to do
something reckless.

So I thought I’d leave dealing with Aoi to
you. Does that make sense?

Gotcha. If that’s how you feel, then I’ll go
after her.

Anyway, I’m gonna run back to the school and
fill the others in.

While I’m doing that, you and Agumon go talk
with Aoi!
You got it! Which way did she go?

She seemed to be walking in the direction of
the forest up ahead.

Then if we go that way, I might be able to
get a sense of where Labramon is!

That settles it. Let’s head to that forest,
Agumon!
